ground_truth_fields.expected_value: Experiment 1 is divided into 2 sets. In the first set 2x4 samples were obtained from earthworms (Eisenia fetida) exposed to control and multi-component 4n-6 nanomaterial treatments, respectively. In the second set 2x4 samples were obtained from worms exposed to negative and positive control (Manganese chloride) treatments, respectively. Experiment 2 is obtained from an experiment in which earthworms (Eisenia fetida) exposed to control and 4n-4 nanomaterial treated soil, respectively. Worms were exposed to either of the treatments for 2, 3, 4 or 7 days, after which they were harvested. 4 jars were used per treatment and exposure time, which resulted in a total of 32 jars. Every jar contained 4 worms of which one was selected for RNA-seq. Furthermore, 4 worms were frozen at the start of the experiment, which served as the references. Experiment 3 is obtained from an experiment in which earthworms (Eisenia fetida) exposed to control and multi-component 4n-6 nanomaterial treated soil, respectively. Worms were exposed to either of the treatments for 2, 3, 4 or 7 days, after which they were harvested. 4 jars were used per treatment and exposure time, which resulted in a total of 32 jars. Every jar contained 4 worms of which one was selected for RNA-seq. Furthermore, 4 worms were frozen at the start of the experiment, which served as the references.

ground_truth_fields.expected_value: BIOREM: International Staff Exchange for Innovative Bioremediation Technologies
ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Derived from the project acronym 'BIOREM' and its focus on bioremediation, staff exchange, and innovation as described in objectives and research focus.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 0.9

ground_truth_fields.expected_value: BIOREM is a Horizon Europe MSCA Staff Exchange project that fosters international, inter-sectoral collaboration to advance bioremediation technologies through staff mobility, training, and integration of omics, AI, and synthetic biology. It aims to develop tailored solutions for soil pollution using microbial consortia, smart carriers, and plant-microbe interactions, with strong emphasis on knowledge transfer, open science, and exploitation.
ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Synthesized from project objectives, working packages, consortium roles, and strategic alignment sections.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Named in the dissemination and exploitation section as 'Ma Beatz Lapuente (UBU)' leading dissemination activities.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Full name 'Ma Beatz Lapuente' appears in the dissemination and exploitation plan as lead contact.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: UBU is listed as the coordinator and participant organization; Ma Beatz Lapuente is affiliated with UBU.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Open access policy states CC BY license for publications and data where possible.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: The grant agreement number is provided in the document as '101183128', which serves as a unique identifier for the project.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.expected_value: Physicochemical and Omics-Based Characterization of Contaminated Soils Across European Sites
ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Based on WP2 description involving characterization of polluted soils using physicochemical and omics methods.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.expected_value: This study involves collecting and characterizing soil samples from at least three polluted European sites to assess contamination levels (TPH, PAH, metals), soil properties, and microbial community composition via metagenomics and transcriptomics, supporting downstream bioremediation strategy development.
ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Extracted from WP2 objectives, deliverables (D2.2, D2.3), and secondment knowledge transfer related to soil analysis.
ground_truth_fields.notes: Extracted from FAIRiAgent output with confidence 1.0

ground_truth_fields.evidence_location: Project start date is June 2024; all studies begin no earlier than project initiation.
